channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 19 May
item.description: The number of Covid-19 cases in the US has exceeded 1.5 million and nearly 90,000 have died, as the country goes into phase two of trialling a vaccine. Follow our blog for the latest.

item.title: Covid-19 a trip down memory lane for polio survivors
item.description: As children return to school this week it may come as a surprise to learn their experience is remarkably similar to that of their forebears almost 100 years ago.

item.title: Police investigate weekend cell phone tower fires
item.description: People who set fire to cell phone towers in response to conspiracy theories about 5G will be dealt with "very firmly", Police Commissioner Andrew Coster says.

item.title: Back to school after lockdown: 80 percent of children return to classes with hygiene rules
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children returned to school and early learning today, squirting litres of hand sanitiser and putting carefully-developed hygiene plans to the test.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 18 May
item.description: There were no new cases of Covid-19 announced after the first weekend of level 2 rules, as kids get back to school for the first time in weeks.

item.title: Cardinal welcomes review of church gathering rules
item.description: Checkpoint - The government has signalled it will reconsider rules that cap the number of people at religious services at 10, as the Catholic Church continues to hold online services.

item.title: Oil tanker off Taranaki poses spill risk that could cost taxpayers
item.description: Taxpayers could end up liable if a ship anchored off Taranaki spills any of its 40,000 barrels worth of crude oil.

item.title: Heavy cannabis smokers can have badly damaged lungs for life - study
item.description: Heavy cannabis users - who are prone to destructive lung disease sometimes known as "bong lung" - can suffer irreversible lung damage, a New Zealand study suggests.

item.title: Man charged in relation to crash that killed off-duty police officer
item.description: A man has been charged in relation to a crash that killed a police officer in February.

item.title: State housing tenants mistakenly told their homes are uninsured
item.description: Housing development agency K훮inga Ora has apologised to tenants left confused and worried by a letter about their homes being uninsured.

item.title: Ashley Bloomfield and Andrew Coster on Covid-19 and level 2 rules
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand after the first weekend of level 2 rules.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 18 May
item.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster said there have been 983 breaches - 700 were related to business and 250 to mass gatherings. Read back through today's events here.

item.title: Police 'stocktake' surveillance tech after Clearview AI facial recognition trial
item.description: The Police Commissioner has ordered a stocktake of surveillance technologies after police trialed controversial facial recognition software without consulting his office.

item.title: Observing Ramadan in lockdown
item.description: Voices - Lockdown and Ramadan make for a very unusual combination. This year, for most Muslims in New Zealand, observing the fast has been more challenging.

item.title: New Zealand population hits 5 million
item.description: New Zealand's population has topped 5 million, according to Statistics NZ.

item.title: Surge in commuters on the roads and a stress test for public transport
item.description: Despite many more workers heading into offices and about 800,000 pupils back to school, it was smooth sailing on Auckland and Wellington roads today.

item.title: Government reveals $278.2m for early childhood education funding
item.description: The government has announced $278.2 million from the Budget will go towards restoring the 100 percent funding band for teacher-led ECE services. Watch live here.

item.title: M훮ori Council welcomes unity in confronting government during Covid-19
item.description: M훮ori unified to confront the government over alarming Covid-19 rules for tangi and marae, the M훮ori Council says.
